skill.name: microsoft-foundry
skill.description: Use this skill to work with Microsoft Foundry (Azure AI Foundry) and tools from Foundry MCP server: deploy AI models, manage AI agents (create, deploy, invoke, run, troubleshoot Foundry Agents), manage RBAC permissions and role assignments, manage quotas and capacity, create Foundry resources. USE FOR: Microsoft Foundry, AI Foundry, create agent, deploy agent, debug agent, invoke agent, run agent, agent chat, evaluate agent, agent monitoring, deploy model, model catalog, knowledge index, create Foundry project, new Foundry project, set up Foundry, onboard to Foundry, create Foundry resource, create AI Services, AIServices kind, register resource provider, enable Cognitive Services, setup AI Services account, create resource group for Foundry, RBAC, role assignment, quota, capacity, TPM, deployment failure, QuotaExceeded. DO NOT USE FOR: Azure Functions (use azure-functions), App Service (use azure-create-app), generic Azure resource creation (use azure-create-app).
skill.summary: Microsoft Azure AI Foundry skill for building, deploying, and managing AI agents and models.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The 1370 flagged patterns are documentation code examples in markdown files, not actual code execution. This is an official Microsoft skill for Azure AI Foundry operations. The backtick syntax in markdown code blocks triggered external_commands alerts, path references in docs triggered filesystem alerts, and .env documentation triggered env_access alerts. No malicious intent or actual security vulnerabilities found.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Documentation Code Examples
dangerous_patterns.description: All 1370 flagged patterns are code examples in markdown documentation, not executable code. The static analyzer detected backtick syntax in markdown code blocks as 'shell commands', path references as 'path traversal', and .env usage as 'environment access'.

content.user_title: Build AI Agents with Microsoft Foundry
content.value_statement: This skill helps developers build, deploy, and manage AI agents and models in Microsoft Azure AI Foundry. It provides comprehensive workflows for agent creation, model deployment, capacity planning, RBAC management, and troubleshooting.
actual_capabilities: Create AI agents using Microsoft Agent Framework SDK with single-agent and multi-agent workflow patterns
Deploy containerized AI agents to Azure Container Registry and Azure Container Apps
Discover and deploy AI models across Azure regions with capacity planning
Manage RBAC permissions and role assignments for Foundry resources
Troubleshoot agent issues by viewing container logs and querying telemetry
limitations: Requires existing Azure subscription and Foundry project
Does not create Azure subscriptions or billing accounts
Cannot modify resource quotas beyond what Azure allows
Requires proper RBAC permissions to perform operations

use_cases.title: Build and Deploy Enterprise AI Agents
use_cases.description: Create AI agents using the Microsoft Agent Framework SDK with custom tools and multi-agent workflows, then deploy them to Azure Container Apps for production.

use_cases.title: Manage Model Deployments at Scale
use_cases.description: Discover available model capacity across Azure regions, deploy models with custom configurations, and manage deployment lifecycles efficiently.

use_cases.title: Configure Access Control for AI Resources
use_cases.description: Set up RBAC permissions, manage role assignments, and configure managed identities for secure access to Foundry resources.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new AI agent using Microsoft Agent Framework. The agent should use the gpt-4o model and have a tool that can search Azure documentation.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to scaffold a new AI agent from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Deploy Agent to Production
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my agent to Azure Container Apps. Use ACR for image storage and configure the agent with environment variables for the project endpoint.
prompt_templates.scenario: User has agent code and wants to deploy it

prompt_templates.title: Find Model Capacity
prompt_templates.prompt: Find available capacity for deploying gpt-4o in the East US region. I need at least 10K TPM.
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs to deploy a model but wants to check availability first

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshoot Agent Failure
prompt_templates.prompt: My agent deployment is failing. Check the container logs and tell me what errors are occurring.
prompt_templates.scenario: User's deployed agent is not working correctly

output_examples.input: Create a new agent with the GPT-4 model
output_examples.output: I will create a new AI agent using the Microsoft Agent Framework. Let me first check your Azure Foundry project configuration...
I'll help you deploy the agent to Azure. This involves: 1) Building the container image, 2) Pushing to ACR, 3) Creating the agent definition in Foundry.

output_examples.input: Where can I deploy a model with 5000 TPM?
output_examples.output: I'll check capacity across Azure regions for you. Let me query the available capacity...

best_practices: Use azd (Azure Developer CLI) for project context management and environment variables
Read sub-skill documents before executing workflows - each has specific steps and validation
Configure environment variables in .env files for local development before deployment
Use managed identities instead of embedding credentials in agent configurations
anti_patterns: Do not skip reading sub-skill documentation before executing workflows
Do not hardcode Azure credentials in agent source code - use environment variables
Do not deploy agents without configuring proper RBAC permissions first

faq.question: What is Microsoft Azure AI Foundry?
faq.answer: Microsoft Azure AI Foundry (formerly Azure AI Foundry) is a platform for building, customizing, and managing enterprise AI applications with integrated AI agents, model deployment, and lifecycle management.

faq.question: Do I need an Azure subscription to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you need an active Azure subscription with access to Azure AI Foundry. The skill will help you configure your local environment to connect to your Foundry projects.

faq.question: Can this skill create new Azure resources?
faq.answer: This skill can help create Foundry projects, resources, and manage deployments. For creating base Azure resources like subscriptions, you would need separate tools.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The Microsoft Agent Framework supports Python. The skill includes examples and workflows for Python-based agent development.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot deployment failures?
faq.answer: Use the troubleshoot sub-skill to view container logs, query telemetry, and diagnose issues. The skill provides commands for retrieving diagnostic information.

faq.question: Can I use my own model with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you can deploy custom models or use models from the Azure Model Catalog. The skill supports both preset deployments and fully customized deployments.
